result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyrie Jason Hines was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 10:45 AM.
Defendant Kyrie Jason Hines in court with attorney Richard Russell McCue.  Katherine M. Findley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney McCue informs the court this matter is resolved, and files plea and waiver form with the court.
Defendant changes plea of "NOT GUILTY" to "NO CONTEST".
Court questions defendant re: plea and waiver of rights, court also questions attorney McCue re: his clients plea and waiver of rights.
Parties stipulate to a factual basis.
Court finds plea and waiver is made freely, knowingly & intelligently.
Court accepts plea and finds the defendant "GUILTY" to Count 1.
State moves for joint recommendation of the parties.
Attorney McCue concurs with the state and make statement on behalf of his client.
Court grants motion of the parties and orderer the defendant to the Lafayette County Jail for a period of 10 days + Court Costs in this matter (60 DTP/Judgment).
Defendant wishes to waive Huber.
Bond stays in place until defendant reports on 01/06/2017 on or before 6:00 PM. (Refund to Shelly A. Hines).  Review scheduled for January 9, 2017 at 08:00 am.
